gurmukhi: Aiq hI iqh TwN jb mwr mcI Air jwq BXo niB mY Clu kY kY ] lY kir pwhun biRst krI suq sXwm ky pY Aiq kRu`Dq hÍY kY ]
transliteration: At(i) Hitih Thaan Job Maar Machiar(i) Jaat Bhayo Nabh(i) Mai Chhal(u) Kai Kai|| Lai Kar(i) Paahoun Brisht Karisout Syaam Ke Pai At(i) Kruddhat Hvai Kai||
translation: When the dreadful fighting continued there, the enemy deceptively reached the sky and from there he showered stones on the son of Krishna;

gurmukhi: so ien pwhn ibArQ kry iqn ko sr eykih eyk lgY kY ] SsqRn soN iqn ko qn boD kY BUm firE Aiq ros bFY kY ]2028]
transliteration: So In Paahan Be-arth Dare Tin Ko Sar Ekah(i) Ek Lagad Kai|| Shastran Son Tin Ko Tan Bedh Kai Bhoom Dario At(i) Ros Badhai Kai||2028||
translation: Pradyumna made those stones harmless with his arrows by intercepting them and pierced his body with his weapons, causing him to fall on the ground.2028.

gurmukhi: As AYNc Jtwk lXo kit qy isr sMbr kY su Jtwk dY JwrXY ] dyvn ky gn hyrq jy iqn paurK dyK kY DMin aucwrXo ]
transliteration: As Binch Jhataak Layo Kattee Te Sir Sanbar Kai Su Jhataak Dai Jhdaryo|| Devan Ke Gad Heart Je Tin Paurakh Dekh Kai Dhann(i) Ouchdaryo||
translation: Pradyumna struck his sword with a jerk and cutting the head of Shambar threw it down; the gods, seeing such a bravery, hailed him;

gurmukhi: BUim igrwie dXo kY ibmu`Cq sRon sMbUh Drw pY ibQwrXo ] kwnH ko pUq spUq BXo ijn eyk kiRpwn qy sMbr mwrXo ]2029]
transliteration: Bhoom(i) Giraae Dayo Kai Bimouchchhat Sron Sanbooh Dharaa Pai Bithdaryo|| Kaahn Ko Poot Sapoot Bhayo Jin Ek Kridaan Te Sanbar Mdaryo||2029||
translation: Making the demon unconscious, he knocked him down on the earth; bravo to the son of Krishna, who killed Shambar with one blow of his sword.2029.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnwvqwry prduMmn sMbr dYq hr lY gXo ieq sMbr ko prduMmn bD kIE iDAwie smwpq ] APjU ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachita Naatak Granthe Krishnaavatdare Pardounman Sanbar Dait Har Lai Gado It Sanbar Ko Pardounman Badh Keeo Dhiaae Samaapt|| Aphjoo||
translation: End of the Chapter ‘Description of the Abduction of Pradyumna by the demon Shambar and killing of Shambar by Pradyumna’ in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ prduMmn sMbr ko bD rukmn ko imly ]
transliteration: Ath Pardounman Sanbar Ko Badh Roukman Ko Mile||
translation: Now begins the description of the meeting of Pradyumna with Rukmani after killing Shambar

gurmukhi: iqh ko bD kY prdumn AwXo Apny gRyh ] riq Apny piq sMig qbY kihE bFY kY nyh ]2030]
transliteration: Tih Ko Badh Kai Pardouman Aayo Apne Greh|| Rat(i) Apne Pat(i) San(i) Tabai Kahio Badhai Kai Neh||2030||
translation: After killing him, Pradyumna came to his home, then Rati was extremely pleased to meet her husband.2030.

gurmukhi: cIl Awp huie Awpny aUpir pqih cVwie ] rukmn ko giH Qo jhw qh hI phucI Awie ]2031]
transliteration: Cheel Aap Hue Aapne Oopar(i) Patah(i) Chadhaae|| Roukman Ko Grah(i) Tho Jahaa Tah Hipahouchiaae||2031||
translation: After transformed herself into a culture and got her husband mounted on her and carrying him reached the palace of Rukmani.2031.

gurmukhi: Cor kY cIl ko rUp dXo qRIAw ko Aiq suMdir rUp bnwXo ] vwh auqwr kY kMDih qy iqh kMD ptMbr pIq DrwXo ]
transliteration: Chhodh Kai Cheel Ko Roop Dayo Treeyaa Ko At(i) Soundar(i) Roop Banaayo|| Vaah Outaar Kai Kandhah(i) Te Tih Kandh Patanbar Peet Dharaayo||
translation: She abandoned there the body of vulture and assumed her own beautiful figure of a woman after dismounting Pradyumna from her shoulder, she caused him to wear the yellow garments;

gurmukhi: sorh hjwr qRIAw sB QI jh TwF iqno ieh rUp idKwXo ] so sukcI icq bIc sBY ieh BwNiq lKXo biRjnwiek AwXo ]2032]
transliteration: Sorah Hajaar Treeyaa Sabh Thijah Thaadh Tino Eh Roop Dikhaayo|| So Soukchichit Beech Sabhai Eh Bhaant(i) Lakhyo Brijnaaik Aayo||2032||
translation: Sixteen thousand women saw Pradyumna there and they thought with caution that perhaps Krishna himself had come there.2032.

gurmukhi: qwih inhwir kY sXwm sI mUriq qRIA sBY mn mY sukcwhI ] ilAwXo hY Awn bDU koaU bXwh khY sKI kI su sKI gih bwhI ]
transliteration: Taah(i) Nidaar(i) Kai Syaam Simoondat(i) Treeaa Sabhai Man Mai Soukchaahee|| Liaayo Hai Aan Badhoo Ko( i)  Byaah Kahai Sakhikisu Sakhigadh Baahee||
translation: Seeing the likeness of Krishna in Pradyumna, the women said in their state of shyness that Krishna had then wedded and brought another damsel;
